alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Morris; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 6:33AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Hunterdon, west central Morris, central Warren and east central Northampton Counties through 700 AM EDT... At 633 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pleasant Valley, or 9 miles east of Easton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hackettstown, Washington, High Bridge, Belvidere, Harmony, Oxford, Hope, Glen Gardner, Hampton, Califon, Bloomsbury, Great Meadows-Vienna, Brass Castle, Pleasant Valley, Long Valley, Roxburg, Beatyestown, Allamuchy-Panther Valley, Budd Lake and Beattyestown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 6 and 14. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 7 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
